feat.name: Boon of Advancement
feat.text: Choose a class that you already have levels in, you gain one of the subclass features that you do not already possess. The subclass feature must be the lowest leveled ability that you don't already possess for that subclass.
You can take this Boon multiple times.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Custom Character Boon World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feat.name: Boon of Combat Prowess
feat.text: When you miss with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to hit instead. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Dimensional Travel
feat.text: As an action, you can cast the misty step spell, without using a spell slot or any components. Once you do so, you can't use this boon again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Fate
feat.text: When another creature that you can see within 60 feet of you makes an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, you can roll a d10 and apply the result as a bonus or penalty to the roll. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Fortitude
feat.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 40.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of High Magic
feat.text: You gain one 9th-level spell slot, provided that you already have one.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Immortality
feat.text: You stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you can't die from old age.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Invincibility
feat.text: When you take damage from any source, you can reduce that damage to 0. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Irresistible Offense
feat.text: You can bypass the damage resistances of any creature.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Luck
feat.text: You can add a d10 roll to any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you make. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Magic Resistance
feat.text: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Peerless Aim
feat.text: You can give yourself a +20 bonus to a ranged attack roll you make. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Perfect Health
feat.text: You are immune to all diseases and poisons, and you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Planar Travel
feat.text: When you gain this boon, choose a plane of existence other than the Material Plane. You can now use an action to cast the plane shift spell (no spell slot or components required), targeting yourself only, and travel to the chosen plane, or from that plane back to the Material Plane. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Quick Casting
feat.text: Choose one of your spells of 1st through 3rd level that has a casting time of 1 action. That spell's casting time is now 1 bonus action for you.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Recovery
feat.text: You can use a bonus action to regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Resilience
feat.text: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Skill Proficiency
feat.text: You gain proficiency in all skills.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Speed
feat.text: Your walking speed increases by 30 feet.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage action. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a short rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Spell Mastery
feat.text: Choose one 1st-level sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell that you can cast. You can now cast that spell at its lowest level without expending a spell slot.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Spell Recall
feat.text: You can cast any spell you know or have prepared without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't use this boon again until you finish a long rest.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of the Fire Soul
feat.text: You have immunity to fire damage. You can also cast burning hand (save DC15) at will, without using a spell slot or any components.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of the Night Spirit
feat.text: While completely in an area of dim light or darkness, you can become invisible as an action. You remain invisible until you take an action or a reaction.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of the Stormborn
feat.text: You have immunity to lightning and thunder damage. You can also cast thunderwave (save DC 15) at will, without using a spell slot or any components.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of the Unfettered
feat.text: You have advantage on ability checks made to resist being grappled. In addition, you can use an action to automatically escape a grapple or free yourself of restraints of any kind.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Truesight
feat.text: You have truesight out to a range of 60 feet.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232

feat.name: Boon of Undetectability
feat.text: You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and you can't be detected or targeted by divination magic, including scrying sensors.

Epic boons are used as a form of advancement, a way to provide greater power to characters who have no more levels to gain. With this approach, consider awarding one epic boon to each character for every 30,000 XP he or she earns above 355,000 XP.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide P.232
